Ingredients:

1. 1 cup chole/chick peas
2. 0.5 cup finely chopped onions
3. 0.5 tsp cumin seeds
4. Green chillies
5. Garlic cloves
6. 0.5 tsp black pepper
7. 0.5 tsp coriander powder
8. 0.5 tsp red chili powder
 9. salt to taste
 10. 2 tsp maida
 11. Finely chopped coriander leaves.
 12. 1 tsp lemon juice.
 13. oil for frying

Procedure:

 1.Wash chole and soak overnight.
 2. Transfer the soaked chole into blender jar.
 3. Add onion, cumin seeds, green chilli, garlic, black pepper, coriander powder, red chilli powder, salt, maida, coriander leaves and blend into coarse paste.
 4. Don't blend continuously. Just give a few pulses.
 5. You can use besan in place of maida also.
 6. Add lemon juice and again give just 1-2 pulses.
 7. Transfer the mixture into a bowl.
 8. Cover and rest it in freezer for an hour.
 9. Take a small portion from the mixture and roll them into balls.
 10. Heat the oil on medium flame.
 11. Drop falafel into hot oil and fry well until it gets a nice golden colour.
 12. When the falafel is fried well, take it out, drain the excess oil and transfer into a plate.
 13. Enjoy your falafel. Tastes best with mayo.
